channel.title: The Young Lab on The Young Lab
channel.description: Recent content in The Young Lab on The Young Lab

item.title: Advancements and Challenges in Technology and Data Management Practices of Field-Based, High-Throughput Phenotyping
Visualization for Telemanipulation Tasks by Small, Unmanned Aerial Systems
Unmanned Systems for Agricultural Water Measurement and Management
Currently Recruiting Graduate Students in Biological and Agricultural Engineering at NC State
item.description:
The Young Lab is currently seeking highly motivated graduate students to conduct research developing innovative robotics and sensing technologies for agricultural and environmental monitoring. Students will be part of collaborative, multi-disciplinary projects that seek to improve the sensing and sense-making process in diverse applications, including plant phenotying, environmental monitoring, and precision agriculture. The positions are particularly well-suited for students interested in a mixture of hardware development, data analytics, and field work.

Successful candidates are expected to have experiences and interests in one or more of the following areas: mechatronics, robotics, electronics, computer vision, sensing, and/or machine learning, with strong programming skills in one or more of the following languages: MATLAB, LabVIEW, Python, C/C++, and Java.

Interested applicants are encouraged to send brief description of your research interests and qualifications and curriculum vitae to Dr. Sierra Young at sierrayoung@ncsu.edu.

item.title: Human-Machine Interaction for Telemanipulation by Small Unmanned Systems
“Design and Field Evaluation of a Ground Robot for High-Throughput Phenotyping of Energy Sorghum
“High Precision Control of Tracked Field Robots in the Presence of Unknown Traction Coefficients
item.description:
Full citation:

Kayacan, E., Young, S.N., Peschel, J., and Chowdhary, G. (2018) “Robot-Assisted Measurement for Hydrologic Understanding in Data Sparse Regions.” J. Field Robotics, 1-13. doi.org/10.1002/rob.21794

item.title: Telemanipulation by Unmanned Aerial Vehicles for Agricultural Data Applications
In Situ Measurement of Soil-Water Parameters using a Micro UAV
Robot-Assisted Measurement for Hydrologic Understanding in Data Sparse Regions
item.description:
Full citation:

Young, S. N., Peschel, J.M., Penny, G., Thompson, S., and Srinivasan, V. (2017) “Robot-Assisted Measurement for Hydrologic Understanding in Data Sparse Regions.” Water, 9(7). doi: 10.3390/w9070494
